did.unittitle: Jabez Thomas Sunderland sermons, lectures, addresses, etc. ca. 18978-1898

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The provenance of these materials is unknown.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Jabez Thomas Sunderland sermons, lectures, addresses, etc., Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Jabez T. Sunderland was a Unitarian minister and reformer.

scopecontent.p: This collection of pamphlets and reprints was gathered from different sources. Many of these, in addition to others, will be found in the Jabez T. Sunderland collection.

did.unittitle: Pamphlets and reprints
A College Town Pulpit-monthly sermons by Rev. J.T. Sunderland
Series 1, no. 1: Why Study the Bible?
Series 1, no. 2: Jesus as Humanity's Ideal
Series 1, no. 3: Sectarianism; Its Evils, Causes and Cure
Series 1, no. 6: Loyalty to Conviction
Series 1, no. 7: Is Life a Blessing?
Series 1, no. 8: Robert G. Ingersoll's Treatment of "The Bible"
Series 1, no.9: Religion for a Republic
Series I., no. 10: The Surest Way of Doing Good
Series 2, no. 7: The Ministry of Sorrow
Series 3, no. 1: Why Study the Bible?
Series 3, no. 2: How to Study the Bible
Miscellaneous sermons:
Dr. Winchell's "Preadamites" 1881
The Religion of Lincoln, Webster and Whittier
Immortality in the Light of Evolution
Is the Bible Infallible?
A Ministry of Fifteen Years in a College Town 1893
Rev. B. Fay Mills and the State University-Ought Revivals and Meetings for Sectarian Propagandism to be held in a State Institution of Learning? 1893
Saved by Hope--Farewell Sermon in Ann Arbor
True and False Liberalism--(American Unitarian Association-4th series, no. 56.)
